artist: Artist: Kikukawa Eizan; Publisher: Wakasaya Yoichi
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Two ōban sheets were joined vertically to create a large image of a beautiful woman. Such formats are called kakemono-e (hanging scroll pictures) as they were often mounted onto a simple hanging scroll with a paper border and backing. They were used by townspeople as relatively inexpensive interior decoration. For this reason, these prints rarely survived in their original state and condition.
title: Woman Holding a Roll of Paper
